titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Uriah Franklin "Bill" Corkrum papers circa 1880s-2000
titlestmt.author: Bill Huntington

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-09.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.abstract: Bill Corkrum was a longtime Walla Walla farmer, businessman, and aviator. This collection includes his college records, military records, business records, personal records, and photographs of the Corkrum family, one of the earliest families to settle in Walla Walla.

acqinfo.p: Donated to the Whitman College and Northwest Archives by Barlow Corkrum on October 19, 2007. The accession number is 2007-025.

bioghist.p: Uriah Franklin "Bill" Corkrum was born in Dixie, Washington on March 1, 1917 to a family of early settlers of Walla Walla County, dating back to the 1850s. He attended Washington State College in Pullman for two years before being accepted as a pilot into the Army Air Corps in 1941. Corkrum flew in the Pacific theatre during World War II and was highly decorated, earning the Distinguished Flying Cross and the Air Medal. He was discharged in 1947 having attained the rank of lieutenant colonel.

Corkrum owned and operated one of the largest wheat and green pea operations in Walla Walla County. He was an early innovator and entrepreneur, creating Ag-Data Inc., a local computer company, in the early 1960s. Corkrum died in 2007.

scopecontent.p: The Uriah Franklin "Bill" Corkrum papers houses family papers and letters from the Corkrum, Frazier, Gwin and Chew families. Also included is Bill Corkrum's college memorabilia from his time at Washington State College circa 1938 to 1941, as well as Corkrum's flight logs and military memorabilia from 1941 to 1945. Additionally, it contains farm records from 1947 to 1989 and business records of Ag-Data Inc. circa 1960s. Corkrum's personal photographs and album scrapbooks are also included.
